intro: Argophyllum latifolium, commonly known as the broadleaf argophyllum, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, white powdery coating. It produces small, white or pale pink flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. This species is typically found in heathlands and open forests, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
